atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the @tailwind directive to insert Tailwind’s `base`, `components`, `utilities`, and `variants` styles into your stylesheet.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use @apply to inline any existing utility classes from Tailwind into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the @layer directive to tell Tailwind which of your custom CSS rules belong to which ‘layer’.

atDirectives.name: @variants
atDirectives.description: You can generate `responsive`, `hover`, `focus`, `active`, etc. variants of your own utilities by wrapping them in the @variants directive.

atDirectives.name: @screen
atDirectives.description: The @screen directive allows you to create media queries that reference your Tailwind breakpoints by name instead of duplicating their values in your CSS.
